cyclone.name: CLAUDETTE
cyclone.current_location: about 125 mi (200 km) south of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving north, then turning north-northeast toward the Louisiana coast and the north-central Gulf Coast, before accelerating inland across the southeastern United States
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-central Gulf Coast near Morgan City, Louisiana

weather_observation.watch_coast: None west of Morgan City, LA
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from east of Morgan City, LA to the Okaloosa/Walton County Line, FL including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from coastal Louisiana eastward through Mississippi, Alabama, and the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusts below tropical-storm force possible, generally under 30 mph
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant storm-surge impact expected; surge focus remains east of Texas
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to locally moderate rain bands possible; totals generally under 2 inches
weather_observation.other_hazards: None expected to meaningfully affect port operations
